Description: Body sherd of Linear Style Corinthian pottery convex-walled pyxis; interior reserved and heavily wheel-marked; exterior: glazed area above zigzag maeander frieze; three bands below.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see the powder pyxis in Newhall Stillwell and Benson, ‘Corinth: Results of Excavations Conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens - Vol. XV, Part 3: The Potters Quarter - The Pottery’, Princeton (1984), pl. 65, fig. 1646.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 117, no. A199)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.323) (phase 3)
